description: This dish is, admittedly, a bit decadent. But you DESERVE it. It's creamy, spicy, and really forgiving, so even if something goes wrong the flavor will be on point.

steps.flavor_text: Fill a {e, pot, 1} about halfway with water and set it over high heat to boil. Make sure to salt the water heavily! The Italians do it so we do too.
steps.text: Fill a pot about halfway with water and set it over high heat to boil. Make sure to salt the water heavily! The Italians do it so we do too.

steps.flavor_text: Dice half of an {i, onion, 1}. If it's a large onion or you would prefer a smoother sauce, only use a quarter. Mince 1-2 cloves of {i, garlic, 2}.
steps.text: Dice half of an onion. If it's a large onion or you would prefer a smoother sauce, only use a quarter. Mince 1-2 cloves of garlic.

steps.flavor_text: Locate your tomato paste, pepper flakes, and heavy cream so you're not overwhelmed while you cook!
steps.text: Locate your tomato paste, pepper flakes, and heavy cream so you're not overwhelmed while you cook!

steps.flavor_text: Place a {e, pan, 1} over medium heat and add a splash of olive oil.
steps.text: Place a pan over medium heat and add a splash of olive oil.

steps.flavor_text: Once the oil is hot, add your {i, onion, 1} to the pan and cook until translucent. Salt them a bit and stir occasionally (3-4 minutes).
steps.text: Once the oil is hot, add your onion to the pan and cook until translucent. Salt them a bit and stir occasionally (3-4 minutes).

steps.flavor_text: Add about 1/2 tsp of {i, chili flakes, 1} to the pan and stir them in for around 30 seconds. Feel free to use more or less. Trust yourself!
steps.text: Add about 1/2 tsp of chili flakes to the pan and stir them in for around 30 seconds. Feel free to use more or less. Trust yourself!

steps.flavor_text: Add 2 tbsp of {i, vodka, 1} to the pan. Don't be afraid fo the steam or noise! Stir the vodka around and wait for the liquid to reduce almost all the way (1-3 minutes). You just deglazed a pan!
steps.text: Add 2 tbsp of vodka to the pan. Don't be afraid fo the steam or noise! Stir the vodka around and wait for the liquid to reduce almost all the way (1-3 minutes). You just deglazed a pan!

steps.flavor_text: Add about two heaping spoonfulls of 3 tbsp of {i, tomato paste, 1} to the pan. Cook the paste for about 2-3 minutes to get rid of the raw flavor. It should darken in color and form an ugly looking heap of onions and paste.
steps.text: Add about two heaping spoonfulls of 3 tbsp of tomato paste to the pan. Cook the paste for about 2-3 minutes to get rid of the raw flavor. It should darken in color and form an ugly looking heap of onions and paste.

steps.flavor_text: Add 1/4 cup of {i, heavy cream, 1} to the mixture and stir to combine until you have a vibrant, light orange sauce.
steps.text: Add 1/4 cup of heavy cream to the mixture and stir to combine until you have a vibrant, light orange sauce.

steps.flavor_text: Add a pinch of salt and pepper and turn the heat down to the lowest setting.
steps.text: Add a pinch of salt and pepper and turn the heat down to the lowest setting.

steps.flavor_text: Add your desired amount of dried {i, pasta, 1} (peferably rigatoni or penne) to your boiling water. About 1 cup of dried pasta is a serving. Cook the pasta for 1 minute less than the box instructs.
steps.text: Add your desired amount of dried pasta (peferably rigatoni or penne) to your boiling water. About 1 cup of dried pasta is a serving. Cook the pasta for 1 minute less than the box instructs.

steps.flavor_text: Once the pasta is done, kill the heat and use a {e, measuring cup, 1} or mug to scoop out about a cup of pasta water. Add splashes of the collected pasta water to the sauce and stir until the desired consistency is reached. Add in your pasta and continue tinkering with the sauce consistency, adding in water and stirring as you go. Cook the pasta for about 1 more minute in the sauce.
steps.text: Once the pasta is done, kill the heat and use a measuring cup or mug to scoop out about a cup of pasta water. Add splashes of the collected pasta water to the sauce and stir until the desired consistency is reached. Add in your pasta and continue tinkering with the sauce consistency, adding in water and stirring as you go. Cook the pasta for about 1 more minute in the sauce.

steps.flavor_text: Plate with parmesan cheese, more chili flakes, or anything else your heart desires. You deserve this pasta!
